data.title: University of Richmond Athletics
data.meta_description: PHOENIX — Spiders guard Jordan King is one of 21 players who have been selected to play in the annual NABC – Reese's Division I College All-Star Game Friday at State
data.text:
Men's Basketball 04/02/2024

King to Play in Reese's All-Star Game at Final Four Friday

PHOENIX — Spiders guard Jordan King is one of 21 players who have been selected to play in the annual NABC – Reese's Division I College All-Star Game Friday at State Farm Stadium in Phoenix, site of this year's Final Four.

The game tip at 6:30 PM ET and be broadcast live on CBS Sports Network. Admission to the game is free, and live stats will be available at http://nabc.statbroadcast.com/. King will be a part of the East All-Stars, coached by Oakland's Greg Kampe.

Spider center Grant Golden was named MVP of the game in New Orleans in 2022 after scoring 14 points with eight rebounds and four assists while leading the East to a 115-103 win.

King averaged 18 points per game and shot 41.4 percent from three-point range for the Spiders this season while leading Richmond to its first Atlantic 10 regular season title. He was named Atlantic 10 Co-Player of the Year, All-Atlantic 10 First Team, and A-10 All-Academic Team in March.

Reese's Division I East All-Stars

Jamison Battle, Ohio State

Isaiah Cozart, Eastern Kentucky

Jack Gohlke, Oakland

Jordan King, Richmond

Josh Oduro, Providence

Drew Pember, UNC Asheville

Jahmir Young, Maryland

Head Coach: Greg Kampe, Oakland
